raw_comment:
In all of the graphs, less than 50% of the head coaches are People of Color. I also notice that the only leagues that have a proportion of Players of Color that is greater than 75%, Women’s National Basketball Association and the National Basketball Association, are both Basketball leagues. Only the Major League Baseball league has a proportion of Players of Color that is less than 50%. 
I wonder why Baseball is the only league with less than 50% of Players of Color. I also wonder why the Basketball leagues are the only leagues where the proportion of Players of Color is larger than 75%. As well as why there is such a low proportion of Head Coaches of Color.
It is important to my community of People of Color because the lack of representation of People of Color would make Children of Color hesitant to be a professional athlete or feel that they could not be an athlete and instead choose a different profession and instead work towards a different profession.
The graph is describing the proportion of Players of Color and Head Coaches of Color in various major sports leagues. A catchy headline for this set of graphs is “Lack of Diversity in Major Sports Leagues”.
